intro: Decaloba obscura, commonly known as the dark decaloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
